text: Shirley Vivian Teresa Brittain Williams, Baroness Williams of Crosby, (née Catlin; 27 July 1930 – 12 April 2021) was a British politician. Williams was originally a Labour MP - first elected to the House of Commons in 1964 - but left to found the Social Democratic Party (later the Liberal Democrats) in 1981. She served in government through the 1960s and 70s, but was defeated as an MP in 1983. She was awarded a life peerage in 1993 and retired in 2016. She was made a Companion of Honour in 2017. Williams was the daughter of the author Vera Brittain and Sir George Catlin. She died on 12 April 2021, aged 90. ==References== Category:1930 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Academics of the University of Cambridge Category:Academics of the University of Oxford Category:Alumni of the University of Oxford Category:Columbia University alumni Category:English Roman Catholics Category:Labour Party (UK) MPs Category:Liberal Democrats (UK) MPs Category:Members of the British House of Commons for English constituencies Category:Harvard University faculty Category:Journalists from London Category:Liberal Democrat Life Peers Category:Secretaries of State of the United Kingdom Category:Social Democratic Party (UK) MPs Category:UK MPs 1964–1966 Category:UK MPs 1966–1970 Category:UK MPs 1970–1974 Category:UK MPs 1974 Category:UK MPs 1974–1979 Category:UK MPs 1979–1983 Category:Politicians from London
title: Shirley Williams
